speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, pick up, will you?  It's Frasier. [_beat_] All right, fine.  Call me later. [_hanging up, to Roz_] I don't even know why I bother anymore.  He doesn't pick up phones these days, just waitresses.

speaker: Roz
text: Give him a break, he's just having fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's exactly what I'd expect to hear from someone who's willing to spend the night as Bulldog's squeak toy.

speaker: Roz
text: That is not funny!  It was one night, and I would appreciate it if you would just let it drop.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, I'm sorry, that was tactless of me.  Tell you what, let me make it up to you.  I've got an extra theater ticket tonight.  Faye's busy, why don't you join me?

speaker: Roz
text: No, thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, please, Roz.  It's a delightful little show.  I'll even throw in dinner.

speaker: Roz
text: Busy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really.  A date?

speaker: Roz
text: [_exploding_] I have plans!  Plans!  What are you, a cop?! I've got to account for every waking minute?!  My private life is my own business!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizing_] Bulldog!

speaker: Roz
text: [_bursting into tears_] I don't know what's wrong with me! I'm weak.  I can't stop myself!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes you can, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, I don't want to stop myself.  He's good.  He's really good.  I mean, I'm better, but he's trainable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, it's Bulldog!  Doesn't that bother you?

speaker: Roz
text: You'd think.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, Roz, you still going to help me, uh, write those... promos for my show tonight?  Around 10:00?

speaker: Roz
text: It's okay, Bulldog, he knows.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  But high marks on that cryptic cover story.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_drums his fists on Frasier's chest, then_] I've gotta make a call.  Station manager's been calling me all day. [_to Roz_] Oh, I made us a reservation.  Thought maybe we could get a little dinner first.

speaker: Roz
text: You mean... eat together?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah.  I'll be right back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's beautiful, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh God, this ruins everything!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, didn't you hear what he said?  He wants to buy me dinner.  Do you realize what this means?

speaker: Frasier
text: They finally opened that new Hooters out by the airport?

speaker: Roz
text: No.  He's crossed the line.  He actually thinks we're dating!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, didn't your mother warn you that sex could lead to things like dating?

speaker: Roz
text: [_shaken_] Look, that is it.  I'm going to put an end to this before it goes too far.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I don't believe it. They just fired me. _Frasier and Roz are shocked.  Bulldog tries to brazen it out, but he's very upset._

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah.  They said my ratings are low, the show's losing its edge, I'm getting soft.  My last day's Friday.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_concerned_] Oh, Bulldog, I'm so sorry.  Are you all right?

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, I'm not. [_slamming the counter weakly_] This stinks. This is total B.S. [_breaking into tears_] You don't think I'm getting soft, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, not at all. [_handing him a tissue_] Here.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_blowing his nose_] I just thank God I got a girlfriend like you, Roz.  I don't think I can face this alone. _He walks over to her and hangs his head, expecting to be comforted. Roz shoots Frasier a panicked look, but Frasier nods at her to comfort him.  Bulldog forces the issue by enfolding her in a big hug, which she barely tolerates._

speaker: Roz
text: [_lightly patting his back_] There, there. _Frasier grabs Roz's hands and places them around Bulldog's back in a comforting hug as he slips out the door.  FADE OUT_ **MOON AROUND THE RING**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment - Morning Frasier enters in his dressing gown with his hands behind his back as Martin reads the paper at the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne!  Morning, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey.  _Daphne comes in from the kitchen, her left hand buried in a bag of cheese doodles._

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, please.  Donny's not here.  Will you just take your hand out of the bag?

speaker: Frasier
text: I was just undressing to take my bath, when I sat on the edge of the tub and landed... [_holds up her ring_] on this.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh my God, you found my ring! [_hugging him_] I'd given up, I thought it was someplace I'd never find it!

speaker: Frasier
text: It very nearly was. [_Martin guffaws_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on, let me have it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_indicating her messy hand_] No, no, no, you go rinse off this doodle dust first.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, right, yes.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you sure saved Daphne there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and I also did myself a little favor as well.  Can you imagine what conclusions Faye might have jumped to had she found this engagement ring in my room?

speaker: Faye
text: Oh, Frasier, for me?  I had no idea!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, uh...

speaker: Faye
text: [_grabbing the ring_] It's beautiful!  It's so beautiful! Yes, Frasier, I do!  I do! _She gives him a big kiss.  He gropes for words to explain.  She looks at him knowingly._

speaker: Faye
text: Oh, calm down, you big dope.  I know it's Daphne's ring.

speaker: Faye
text: And, uh, I can't tell you how flattered I am by those beads of sweat on your forehead.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calling after her_] Well, they're love beads, honey! [_to Martin_] Oh God, will you take this thing?

speaker: Martin
text: [_taking the ring_] Well, I don't want it!  What if Bonnie sees me with it?

speaker: Bonnie
text: Sees you with what?

speaker: Martin
text: [_flustered_] Daphne, will you come in here and take this damn ring, please?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_o.s._] Coming!

speaker: Martin
text: [_seating Bonnie_] Sit down and have a little coffee.  _Daphne and Faye return from the kitchen as Donny emerges from Daphne's room in robe and slippers._

speaker: Donny
text: Good morning, everybody!  Another full house, I see.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and that robe is available for purchase in the gift shop.

speaker: Donny
text: Hi. [_kissing Daphne and noticing her hand_] Oh, you found your ring!

speaker: Daphne
text: What?  You knew it was gone?

speaker: Donny
text: Well, Daphne, when your fiancee gives you a hug with a chicken on her hand, then bells go off.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry-

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, that's okay, honey. [_kisses her_] You know, I didn't want to say anything because I knew it would turn up sooner or later, and I didn't want to make you feel worse.

speaker: Frasier
text: As long as we're tying up loose ends here, I was just wondering, what was your ring doing on the edge of my Jacuzzi tub, right next to my favorite scented candle -- which was burned down to the wick?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm going to let my attorney handle this one.

speaker: Donny
text: I'm sorry, Frasier.  I guess after a little champagne we got into the mood, and into the nude, and into the tub.  But don't worry, we'll replace the candle.

speaker: Frasier
text: If only you could replace the image.  Next time, if you don't mind, will you just turn down the temperature a little?

speaker: Donny
text: Actually, we tried, but the knob was stuck.

speaker: Bonnie
text: Yeah, it does that.  You gotta jiggle it a little. _Frasier is shocked that Bonnie and Martin have been using his tub too. The doorbell rings and Martin gets up to answer it._

speaker: Martin
text: Don't worry, it's not what you think!  We use it to give Eddie a bath. _This doesn't make Frasier feel any better.  Donny exits to Daphne's bedroom.  Martin opens the door to find Kit with Niles.  They are dressed in matching black leather jackets for club-hopping, Niles wearing a black t-shirt and pegged pants and looking bleary-eyed but happy - and VERY relaxed.  Frasier is exasperated at Niles's attempt to recapture his youth._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, guys!

speaker: Kit
text: Good morning!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're up early.

speaker: Niles
text: You mean still up.  We never went to bed.

speaker: Kit
text: We'll get there!

speaker: Martin
text: What did you do all night?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, what didn't we do?  We started off at a concert, wonderful group called Uncle Dirtnap.  Then we danced the night away at every club in the U district before finding ourselves at an after-party at Kit's friend Massimo's place.  He's a squatter. Anyway, I wanted to give Kit the keys to my building and I remembered I have a spare set here, so I thought we'd pop by.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well then, let me get them for you.  I can offer you a pastry, courtesy of Le Cigare Volant.

speaker: Kit
text: Oh, no thanks.  You know, those things are loaded with bleached flour.  That stuff's poison. _She takes out a cigarette, which Niles lights without batting an eye. Faye registers this insult to her pastry-making._

speaker: Kit
text: Oh, Niles, give me your cell phone.  I'll call the travel agent.

speaker: Martin
text: You going on a trip?

speaker: Kit
text: Yeah, he's taking me to France for the weekend.  Euro-Disney!

speaker: Niles
text: Massimo said we just had to go.  Apparently it is so lame, it's cool.

speaker: Faye
text: [_getting her coat_] Well, I should get going.  Places to go, people to poison.

speaker: Bonnie
text: I should get going too. [_to Martin_] I'll pick up Lady and meet you and Eddie at the park at 10:30?

speaker: Martin
text: Better make it 11:00.

speaker: Niles
text: [_whispering so Kit doesn't hear_] Frasier, isn't she great?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Niles
text: She's so free, so spontaneous.  She has breathed new life into me. _They both watch as Kit is doubled over with smoker's cough out on the balcony._

speaker: Frasier
text: You may have to return the favor.

speaker: Niles
text: [_as they sit down at the table_] Am I detecting disapproval?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles, not at all, just... Well, all right.  Don't you think you two are going just a bit quickly?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, for the past year you have told me I had to get over Daphne, find someone else.  Now I do and all you can do is find fault.  Man, you are such a buzz kill.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you stop talking like that?  I'm just a little concerned, Niles.  You met this girl last week, she's spent every night with you, now you're giving her the keys to your apartment?

speaker: Niles
text: I think you're just jealous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Jealous?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Here I have attracted this untamed, free spirit, and you're saddled with an uptight pastry chef whose name you can't even remember.

speaker: Frasier
text: Her name is Faye!  And I am not jealous, I'm just a little worried about you.  I'm afraid you might get hurt.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  Here we go.  Whatever would I do, without my wise older brother to tell me what to do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, frankly, you couldn't be acting more like a child. You think I don't know the real reason you came over here? It wasn't to get your keys, it was to show off Lolita's kid sister out there.  The two of you have absolutely nothing in common.

speaker: Kit
text: Well, we're all set for Euro-Disney!

speaker: Niles
text: Great.  You ready to go home?

speaker: Kit
text: Oh, sure.  Bye, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye.

speaker: Kit
text: Oh, I'm so excited for this trip!  I'm going to spend all my time at Fantasy Land.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles? [_Niles turns back to listen_] I'm sorry, I take it back.  You do have something in common. _FADE OUT  END OF ACT THREE  ACT FOUR_ **SOONER OR LATER EVERYONE COMES TO CAFE NERVOSA**  _Scene One -- Cafe Nervosa - Morning In the back of the cafe, Kit jumps into Niles's lap and kisses him as he tries to read the newspaper.  He looks pleased.  Frasier and Roz look on cynically as Frasier sits down at her table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Isn't that a darling sight?  Time was when a waitress said, "Can I warm that up for you?" she was talking about your coffee.  How was your date with Bulldog last night?

speaker: Roz
text: Hideous.  He took me to a nice restaurant, he brought me flowers, and then we went back to his place and cuddled. All I could think of the whole time was, "How do I dump this loser?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz...

speaker: Roz
text: He's meeting me here for coffee and I'm ending this thing once and for all.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking back at Kit and Niles kissing affectionately_] Yeah, well, good luck getting a cup of coffee.  You know, it's the funniest thing.  He really does look happy, doesn't he?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, so just leave it alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe you're right. [_dialing his cell phone_] Do you realize that this is the first time in recent history that all three Crane men have been in happy relationships?  Maybe I should be celebrating that fact rather than being such a buzz kill.

speaker: Roz
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, plug in. [_on the phone, leaving a message_] Hi, honey, it's Frasier.  Listen, I just read a marvelous review of this charming boite out in Freemont and I thought to myself, "that is a place that Cassandra would just love," so-

speaker: Roz
text: [_whispering urgently_] Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_aside to Roz_] Not now, Roz, please.

speaker: Roz
text: You just called her Cassandra!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizing she's right_] Oh, dear God, I'm- [_on the phone_] My producer Roz informs me that I just called you Cassandra. I'm sorry, I don't know why I keep doing this.  I know that you're Faye.  Fabulous Faye!  Forever Faye!  Call me, Faye. [_hanging up, to Roz_] It is one syllable!  What the hell is wrong with me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm glad to see that you think it's funny.

speaker: Roz
text: No, I don't, I just... I'm having a flashback to my summer of Ted, Todd, and Tad. _Bulldog enters the caf e and comes over to their table, handing Roz a cute stuffed dog which she accepts reluctantly.  Frasier gets up to move._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, sports fans!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, uh, Bulldog, hi.  You know what?  You may have my seat. I'm going to sit over there. [_He leaves._]

speaker: Bulldog
text: All right. [_sitting down with Roz_] Hey, gorgeous.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, Bulldog, you and I need to talk about what's been going on between us.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I know.

speaker: Roz
text: [_hissing_] We're in public!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Look. [_hand on his heart_] I want to tell you what's going on in here, okay?

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog, I don't want to know--

speaker: Bulldog
text: Roz, I've gotta be honest with you.  This past week has been amazing, but... I met a total babe at unemployment this morning and we're going to Hawaii this afternoon.

speaker: Roz
text: What?!

speaker: Bulldog
text: I know, I know.  Getting dumped - ouch.  It hurts like hell.

speaker: Roz
text: No, I don't believe this!  I came here to dump you!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, whatever you gotta say to get through this, it's okay with me.

speaker: Roz
text: But-

speaker: Bulldog
text: I know, I know.  I didn't mean to make you fall in love with me.

speaker: Roz
text: [_inarticulate with rage_] I didn't!  You repulse me!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_loudly, rising to leave_] Hey, love hurts, Roz.  And I'm not talking about the time we fell off the kitchen table.  Aloha, old friend.

speaker: Roz
text: [_grabbing the stuffed dog to attack him_] Bulldog, you cuddle lousy and I'm glad you got fired! _Bulldog exits as Roz throws the dog after him.  Frasier looks on, bemused, and another caf e patron lowers his newspaper to get a closer view.  It's Noel, looking sly._

speaker: Noel
text: [_to Roz_] Well, timing is everything.

speaker: Roz
text: Back off, buzz kill!  _She flees to the bathroom.  Noel looks after her, then raises his paper again as Martin comes in and spots Frasier sitting alone._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hey, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_at the counter_] Black coffee to go, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: You okay?

speaker: Martin
text: I just broke it off with Bonnie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gee.  I'm so sorry.  What happened?

speaker: Martin
text: Lady humped Eddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Martin
text: You heard me.  It was humiliating.

speaker: Frasier
text: But Eddie's a boy dog and Lady's a... well, a lady.

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, well, that would be the humiliating part, now wouldn't it?  Right in his own park in front of all those other dogs. [_Frasier starts smiling_] Yeah, Bonnie got a big kick out of it, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: I told her off and that was it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckling_] I'm sorry, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: It's not funny.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, I know, I know. [_trying to be serious, then_] Was he wearing a hat? [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, please, come back...

speaker: Faye
text: Hi, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: [_leaving_] Hey, Faye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, honey.

speaker: Faye
text: [_kissing him_] Hi.  I was near the station so I just thought I'd see if you were around.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, great. [_to Roz, returning to her table_] Oh, Roz, you remember... Faye!

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Faye.

speaker: Faye
text: You were going to say Cassandra, weren't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  Why would you think such a thing?

speaker: Faye
text: Well, for one, I just checked my messages.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm so sorry.  I don't know why it keeps happening. You just have this remarkable resemblance to-

speaker: Faye
text: I know, I know.  Your aunt. [_going to the ladies' room_] I'll be right back.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Roz_] I have got to stop saying Cassandra!

speaker: Cassandra
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Cassandra!

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Cassandra.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, how've you been?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Great.  Actually I've been wanting to talk to you for a while.  We've been sort of... avoiding each other at work and it just all seems so silly.  I mean, I really don't have any hard feelings about the way things ended between us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, that's wonderful.  Neither do I.

speaker: Cassandra
text: You dumped me.  You're not allowed to have hard feelings.  Anyway, my life is great.  I'm back together with Sloan.  You know, you and I should have coffee together sometime.  _Faye returns from the bathroom.  Cassandra doesn't see her, and neither does Frasier at first._

speaker: Frasier
text: That'd be nice, yes.

speaker: Cassandra
text: I'm just glad we're putting all this awkwardness behind us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me, too.  _She moves to hug him, and he is willing until he spots Faye approaching.  Then he twists Cassandra's arm and turns it into a painful handshake that doesn't fool Faye._

speaker: Cassandra
text: Ouch!

speaker: Faye
text: [_to Cassandra_] Hello.

speaker: Cassandra
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sweating_] Well...

speaker: Roz
text: [_jumping in_] Whoa!  I've gotta get back to work. [_to Cassandra_] Going back to the station?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Uh, yes...

speaker: Roz
text: [_pushing her out the door_] Good, I'll walk with you. Oh my God, look at the time.  We've got to hurry.  Bye, Faye.  Bye Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye-bye.  Love you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_leaving_] Yes, you do!

speaker: Faye
text: Who was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know Roz.

speaker: Faye
text: No, the other one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, she's the, um, promotions director.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, she's gorgeous.  Don't you think so?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know, I never really looked.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, don't start looking now. [_kissing him, then exiting_] If I'm going to stay I should feed the meter.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lucky meter. _He savors his narrow escape as Niles comes over to the table and sits down.  He's once again wearing his usual elegant suit._

speaker: Niles
text: Hey there, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, hi.  Listen, Niles, I want to apologize for getting upset this morning.  I've been giving it some thought and I think maybe Kit is just what the doctor ordered.

speaker: Niles
text: [_gloating_] Is she ever!

speaker: Frasier
text: And no strings?  Just fun, right?  That's what she says.

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly.  So, you really like her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I do.

speaker: Niles
text: And you're not just saying that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely not.

speaker: Niles
text: You want her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, she's killing me.  I'm just not cut out for this lifestyle.  Between seeing myself in a mirror at the club dancing my modified Charleston, and then catching my reflection in the store window this morning as I Rollerbladed past in spandex, I feel like I'm being stalked by some pathetic middle-aged ghoul.  Obviously, I've got to break it off with her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh.  I'm so sorry, Niles.  You going to tell her now?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I'll arrange to meet her after work.  To tell you the truth, I think she's losing interest herself.  I couldn't help noticing a little eye-rolling today when my skate wheel got stuck in a storm grate. [_gets up_] And... thanks for not saying "I told you so."

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Kit, there's something I wanted to talk to you about later.

speaker: Kit
text: Just talk to me now.  You know you can tell me anything.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I'd rather do it after your shift.

speaker: Kit
text: You have such a serious face. [_jokingly_] What, are we breaking up or something?

speaker: Niles
text: Well... _Kit drops her tray in shock, shattering coffee cups and thus drawing the attention of the whole caf e. _

speaker: Kit
text: Oh my God!  You just dumped me?  Right here where I work in front of everyone I wait on?

speaker: Niles
text: That's okay, we'll go outside.

speaker: Kit
text: [_yelling hysterically_] Give me an answer!

speaker: Niles
text: [_appalled_] Kit, Kit, calm down-

speaker: Kit
text: You're tired of me?  Is that what it is?

speaker: Niles
text: It's all right-

speaker: Kit
text: You've had enough of me?  I gave you everything and you used me!  Sex, sex, sex!  The way you come to bed every night - wanting it, begging for it!

speaker: Niles
text: I never had to beg!

speaker: Kit
text: I'm just a whore to you, aren't I?

speaker: Niles
text: [_shocked_] No, don't say that!

speaker: Kit
text: That's all I am, your whore!  Your whore from the cafe! _She runs out of the cafe as Niles stands stunned amid the broken crockery.  The other patrons stare at him in dead silence as he attempts to explain._

speaker: Niles
text: It's really more of a compatibility thing.  I'm recently divorced and I've been under a lot of strain...

speaker: Niles
text: It's been very painful for everyone...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, they're strangers.  It's all right, Niles.  Let's just pick this up, shall we?

speaker: Faye
text: What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not really sure, actually.  Just give me a minute, will you?

speaker: Cassandra
text: Excuse me, is Frasier still here?  I just had something I needed to ask him.

speaker: Faye
text: Oh, yeah, he's over there.  I didn't get a chance to meet you before.  I'm Faye. [_holds out her hand_]

speaker: Cassandra
text: [_takes it_] Oh, how do you do?  I'm...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_seeing them together_] _NOOOO!!!_ _The action GOES INTO SLOW MOTION as the two women shake hands and Frasier dives across the caf e to separate them, knocking Niles aside and sending dish towels and china flying.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - The Piano Bar - Evening Frasier is sitting at the bar talking to the bartender as one of the patrons (Jack) noodles around on the piano quietly._  [_N.B. The set is the same as Granville's singles bar in[[4.06]](/frasier/transcripts/season_4/episode_6/mixed_doubles.html "Mixed Doubles") "Mixed Doubles."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking around_] You know, this is a charming little place. I live right around the corner but I've never been in before.

speaker: Bartender
text: What'll it be?

speaker: Frasier
text: Martini, straight up, two olives - henceforth known as "the usual."

speaker: Niles
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: I called Daphne.  She said you'd be here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yeah.

speaker: Niles
text: Cozy room.  I guess it'll have to do, because the old whoremonger won't be going back to Nervosa anytime soon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  I'm pretty much exiled from Le Cigar Volant with Faye working there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I plan to get stinkin' tonight. [_to bartender_] May I see your wine list?  _Niles studies a small card the bartender hands him as Frasier sips his martini and Martin enters the bar with Eddie on a leash._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  What are you doing here?

speaker: Martin
text: I saw Niles's car outside, so I thought I'd stop in for a drink.  I can't go to McGinty's anymore with Bonnie there, and Eddie's taking a break from the park.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, come join us here on Elba. _Martin wraps Eddie's leash around a vacant barstool and sits down next to Frasier._

speaker: Bartender
text: What can I get you?

speaker: Martin
text: Jameson's on the rocks.

speaker: Niles
text: [_handing back the wine list_] And I'll try the... white.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, here we are again - losers in love.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  I don't know what's wrong with me.  I seem incapable of maintaining a relationship.  I date a nice girl like Faye, things seem to be working out, and I seem to find a way to blow it.  It seems to be the pattern of my life.  Well, except with Lilith.  She was just nuts.

speaker: Niles
text: At least you take your time.  I don't date, I leap.  Headfirst. [_accepting his wine from the bartender_] Thank you.  More often than not I get my heart broken - by Maris... [_sipping the wine and grimacing at its flavor_] By Daphne, even if she didn't know it.  At least Kit only broke my box spring.

speaker: Frasier
text: All I can conclude is that I must have some deeper issues with women that manifest themselves in my behavior.  The trick is to pinpoint them.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you know what I'm thinking?  I'm thinking of taking some time off and going into deep analysis.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's not a bad idea, Niles.  Stephen Bachman is at the absolute pinnacle of psychodynamic research.  Perhaps we should see him.

speaker: Niles
text: If we went in together we could get a rate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  Shouldn't take more than a year or so...

speaker: Niles
text: I think that's optimistic...

speaker: Martin
text: Jeez, how do you guys get up in the morning?  You want to go into deep analysis?  Listen to me, I'm your father.  There's nothing wrong with either one of you. [_to Frasier_] You dump a woman but you can't get her off your mind, so you end up getting dumped by the other one.  And you should have stayed with the first one anyway, she was hotter. [_to Niles_] And you? You're just learning how to date.  I mean, it would have been nice if it had happened 25 years ago, but you play the cards you're dealt.  Me?  I like Bonnie, Bonnie's dog humps Eddie, I don't like Bonnie anymore.  It doesn't mean I have "issues with women," it's just life, you know?  Good stuff happens and bad stuff happens, that's all.  You've just gotta look on the bright side.  It's like that old song - "You Gotta Accentuate the Positive."

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe Dad's right.  We do tend to over-analyze things.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey.  I got an idea. [_going over to the piano_] Let's go over here.  Let's do a little singing.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Jack_] Hey, buddy, can you play "Accentuate the Positive"?

speaker: Jack
text: Oh, no, I'm just noodling around.  The real pianist doesn't come till 9:00.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you can fake it, can't you?

speaker: Jack
text: Well no, not really.  I actually only know three songs -- "America the Beautiful," "Happy Birthday" and "Goldfinger."

speaker: Frasier
text: That's all right, buddy-

speaker: Martin
text: No, come on guys, we were gonna sing a happy song, let's sing a happy song. [_to Jack_] Uh, play "Goldfinger."

speaker: Niles
text: We don't know the words to that.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, you knew it when you were kids!  It'll cheer you up, come on. [_to Jack_] Hit it.  _Reluctantly the guys follow Martin over to the piano and stand awkwardly as Jack launches into "Goldfinger."_

speaker: Jack
text: [_plays opening bars, then sings_] Weh-weh-weh, Weh-weh-weh...

speaker: Martin
text: [_prompting_] Goldfinger...

speaker: All
text: [_singing, Frasier and Niles bored_] "Goldfinger!"

speaker: Martin
text: He's the man, the man with the Midas touch.

speaker: All
text: "He's the man, the man with the Midas touch..."

speaker: Martin
text: A spider's touch.

speaker: All
text: "A spider's touch..."

speaker: Martin
text: Such a cold finger.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, this is ridiculous.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, sing it!

speaker: All
text: "Such a cold finger... [_Frasier and Niles start remembering and getting into it_] "Beckons you to enter his web of sin..."

speaker: Martin
text: That's it!
